name: VariableTransformTask
description: Transform value and assign to variable.
author: Jesse Houwing

inputs.helpMarkdown: Input value. You can use other variables as input as with any other text input using the `$(...)` notation anywhere in the value.
inputs.label: Input Value
inputs.name: value

inputs.helpMarkdown: Variable to set. Only supply the variable name and do not include `$(...)`.
inputs.label: Output Variable
inputs.name: variableName
transformAction
inputs.label: Action
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally transform/escape the value. Pick from base64, uri, uri component or slashes.

inputs.name: encodeOrDecode
inputs.label: Direction
inputs.helpMarkDown: Pick between encode or decode using the selcted action.

inputs.name: pointInTime
inputs.label: Apply Transformation
inputs.helpMarkDown: Apply the selected transformation before or after the basic string manipulations. Generally you'd use before when encoding and after when decoding.

inputs.name: searchReplace
inputs.label: Search and Replace
inputs.helpMarkDown: Search and replace values.

inputs.name: searchReplaceMethod
inputs.label: Method
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose from basic (exact match), regex replace or regex match (to extract a value).

inputs.name: searchValue
inputs.label: Search
inputs.helpMarkDown: Value or Expression to search. If you selected Regex Replace or Regex Match, you can use the Javascript regex syntax. See also: (Ecmascript reference)[http://www.ecma-international.org/ecma-262/5.1/#sec-15.10].

inputs.name: replacementValue
inputs.label: Replacement
inputs.helpMarkDown: Replacement value. Use `$1` to use the value of a capturing group. See also: (Ecmascript reference)[http://www.ecma-international.org/ecma-262/5.1/#sec-15.5.4.11].

inputs.name: regexOptions
inputs.label: Regex Options
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the regex options. Use `gim`, `g` - global replace, `i` - case insensitive, `m` - multiline (dot matches newline). See also: (Ecmascript reference)[http://www.ecma-international.org/ecma-262/5.1/#sec-15.10.4.1].

inputs.name: trim
inputs.label: Trim
inputs.helpMarkDown: Trims all whitespace around the value.

inputs.name: slice
inputs.label: Slice
inputs.helpMarkDown: Allows you to select a part of the value.

inputs.name: sliceLeft
inputs.label: Left
inputs.helpMarkDown: Number of characters to remove from the start of the value.

inputs.name: sliceRight
inputs.label: Right
inputs.helpMarkDown: Number of characters to remove from the end of the value. (use negative notation, e.g. `-1`).

inputs.name: substring
inputs.label: Substring
inputs.helpMarkDown: Allows you to select a part of the value.

inputs.name: substringType
inputs.label: Type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the type of method to use to take the part of value.

inputs.name: substringStart
inputs.label: Start
inputs.helpMarkDown: Start the substring at the index specified.

inputs.name: substringLength
inputs.label: Length
inputs.helpMarkDown: Take this number of characters from the specified index (substring), beginning of the string (left) or end of the string (right).

inputs.name: casing
inputs.label: Change Case
inputs.helpMarkDown: Change the case of the value (always uses Invariant).

inputs.name: casingType
inputs.label: Type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose either upper or lowercase.

inputs.name: pad
inputs.label: Pad
inputs.helpMarkDown: Pad the value

inputs.name: padType
inputs.label: Type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Pads either left or right side of the value.

inputs.name: padChar
inputs.label: Character
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use this single character as padding. If none is specified, space ' ' is used.

inputs.name: padLength
inputs.label: Length
inputs.helpMarkDown: Pad the value to the specified length is reached. If the value is already the same length or longer, the value will not be changed.

inputs.helpMarkdown: Use tasklib to set value. (Escapes `\r`, `\n` and `%`)
inputs.label: Use tasklib
inputs.name: useTasklib

instanceNameFormat: Transform value '$(value)' and assign to variable: $(variableName)
